properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A prolonged period of hot weather is expected through the weekend into early next week. Daytime high temperatures in excess of 30 degrees Celsius, with humidex values in the high thirties to low forties, are expected until at least Sunday, and likely beyond. Overnight lows in excess of 20 degrees Celsius are also expected through this period, providing little relief from the heat. Please refer to your public forecast for further details on expected temperatures. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index approaching the high risk category. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-03T19:53:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-03T03:54:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1230757166.2020

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A heat event is expected possibly into the weekend. Inland from Lake Superior, daytime high temperatures near 29 degrees Celsius are expected over the next few days. Overnight lows will range from 16 to 20 degrees Celsius. Areas near Lake Superior will feel slightly cooler temperatures. Please refer to your public forecast for further details on expected temperatures. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index to approach the high risk category. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-03T19:31:56-00:00

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A long duration heat event continues. Daytime high temperatures near 30 degrees Celsius, with humidex values in the mid to high thirties, are expected for the foreseeable future. Overnight lows near 18 degrees Celsius will provide little relief from the heat. Please refer to your public forecast for further details on expected temperatures. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index to approach the high risk category. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-03T19:29:20-00:00

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: 25 to 40 mm of rain has fallen over a broad swath of the BC Interior since early Wednesday morning. Some higher elevation stations in the South Cariboo received 50 to 70 mm of rain in that time period. Showers with isolated thunderstorms will persisting over Prince George, Williston, and McGregor this evening. Brief, heavy downpours from thunderstorms could produce another 5 to 15 mm of rainfall for these regions through tonight. Please refer to the BC River Forecast Centre web page for the latest flood warnings and advisories: http://bcrfc.env.gov.bc.ca/warnings/index.htm ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-03T20:05:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-03T04:06:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3932733484.2020
Area: Williston, Prince George, McGregor
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 1:14 a.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Fast-moving water across a road can sweep a vehicle away. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-03T08:21:38-00:00

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hot weather will continue tonight into Friday. Overnight low temperatures tonight are forecast to remain near or above 20 degrees Celsius. Daytime high temperatures on Friday are expected to top out near 32 degrees Celsius, with Humidex values near 37. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 1:02 a.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a dangerous thunderstorm capable of producing damaging wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This line extends is from north of Gypsumville south to Poplarfield and is traveling northeast at 50 km/h. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-03T08:34:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-03T06:03:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3553836376.2020

Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and large hail. With an approaching upper disturbance and recent heat and moisture in the watch area, severe thunderstorms continue late this evening in southern MB. This watch area will likely be extended as the situation develops this evening and overnight. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Locally heavy rain is also possible. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Temperatures reaching 31 degrees Celsius combined with overnight lows near 20 degrees Celsius are expected for the next day. Hot weather will continue tonight into Friday. Overnight low temperatures tonight are forecast to remain near or above 20 degrees Celsius. Daytime high temperatures on Friday are expected to top out near 32 degrees Celsius, with Humidex values near 38. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 12:52 a.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a dangerous thunderstorm capable of producing damaging wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This line extends is from north of Gypsumville south to Poplarfield and is traveling northeast at 50 km/h. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A long episode of rain, at times heavy, continues. A further 20 to 40 mm of rain expected to fall through Friday over the Peace River, Fort Nelson, Muncho-Lake Park-Stone Mountain Park regions. Heavy rain transitioned into widespread showers and thunderstorms over the region earlier today. While thunderstorm activity is easing late this evening, showers will persist overnight and through Friday. Conditions will finally begin to dry out on Saturday. So far in this rain event 40 to 80 mm of rain has fallen over the region since Wednesday morning. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-03T21:59:51-00:00

properties.Summary:

Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and heavy rain. Thunderstorms continue to move through parts of northwestern Alberta this evening and into the overnight period, some of which have the potential to become severe. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-03T14:14:27-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-03T05:18:27-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1240668766.2020
